org.webmacro.as
Class ActionServlet

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--javax.servlet.GenericServlet
        |
        +--javax.servlet.http.HttpServlet
              |
              +--org.webmacro.servlet.WMServlet
                    |
                    +--org.webmacro.as.ActionServlet
All Implemented Interfaces:
java.io.Serializable, javax.servlet.Servlet, javax.servlet.ServletConfig, org.webmacro.WebMacro
public class ActionServlet
extends org.webmacro.servlet.WMServlet

Highly configurable servlet that enables mapping of HTTP requests to methods of components.

Note: Because ActionServlet is no longer abstract class, subclassing is not necessary unless you need to modify some of its functionality. This means the application can be build only by components and as a main servlet is use directly ActionServlet.

See Also:
Serialized Form

Method Detail

afterInvoke

protected java.lang.Object afterInvoke(java.lang.Object retValue,
                                       org.webmacro.servlet.WebContext context,
                                       java.lang.String form,
                                       java.lang.String action,
                                       java.lang.Object[] convertedParams)
                                throws ActionException
Method called right after each action method invocation. If not overriden - does nothing and returns the passed 'retValue'.
Parameters:
context - context from handle() method
retValue - value returned by action method
form - form that 'action' belongs to (null if not specified)
action - invoked action name
convertedParams - converted parameteters, which have been passed to the action method. Note: 'convertedParams[0]' is context from handle() (is of type WebContext).
Returns:
error code or template to be displayed (or just retValue)
Throws:
ActionException - never (by default)

beforeConversion

protected void beforeConversion(org.webmacro.servlet.WebContext context,
                                java.lang.String form,
                                java.lang.String action)
Method called before any parameter type handler is invoked. Does nothing by default.
Parameters:
context - context from handle() method
form - form that 'action' belongs to (null if not specified)
action - action to be invoked

beforeInvoke

protected java.lang.Object beforeInvoke(org.webmacro.servlet.WebContext context,
                                        java.lang.String form,
                                        java.lang.String action,
                                        java.lang.Object[] convertedParams)
                                 throws ActionException
Method called right before each action method. If not overriden - does nothing and returns null.
Parameters:
context - context from handle() method
form - form that 'action' belongs to (null if not specified)
action - action to be invoked
convertedParams - converted parameteters, which will be passed to the action method. Note: 'convertedParams[0]' is context from handle() (is of type WebContext).
Returns:
error code or template to be displayed (if not null, the action 'action' should be invoked)
Throws:
ActionException - never (by default)

conversionError

protected org.webmacro.Template conversionError(org.webmacro.servlet.WebContext context,
                                                java.lang.String form,
                                                java.lang.String action,
                                                ConversionException e)
                                         throws ActionException
Method called on parameter conversion error or when a HTTP parameter is missing or has a wrong name. Logs exception and calls error() by default.
Parameters:
context - context from handle() method
form - form that 'action' belongs to (null if not specified)
action - action which cannot be called due to the error
e - exception which caused the error
Returns:
template to be displayed
Throws:
ActionException - on conversion error

destroySession

public void destroySession()
Invalidates this thread's session and forces destroy()-ing of components with "session" persistence (does nothing if called from a non-session thread).

Returns:
null if not assigned

getComponent

public java.lang.Object getComponent(java.lang.String componentName,
                                     boolean create)
                              throws java.lang.IllegalStateException
Returns component of a given name.
Parameters:
componentName - corresponds to the component name attribute from ActionConfig
create - true = the component will be created if doesn't yet exist
Returns:
null if the component name is unknown or an instantiation error occurs
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the method is called from a non-session thread (only for components with "session" persistence)

name - property name
Throws:
java.util.MissingResourceException - if the property is not defined

Returns:
session id - even if the session has been invalidated
Throws:
java.lang.IllegalStateException - if the method is called from a non-session thread

handle

public org.webmacro.Template handle(org.webmacro.servlet.WebContext context)
                             throws org.webmacro.servlet.HandlerException
Handles HTTP request. This method controls invocation of methods according to ActionConfig using these rules:

  1. If the value of 'action' parameter is not defined in the HTTP reqest of a new session, 'new-session-template' template from ActionConfig is returned.
  2. If the value of 'action' parameter is defined in the HTTP reqest of a valid session, last action is reinvoked - using same parameter values (this happens when browser reloads the same page).
  3. If the value of 'action' parameter is defined, the assigned action method is called. If a conversion error occurs (before the action method is invoked), conversionError() is called.
  4. If the value of 'action' parameter is not assigned to any action method, unassignedAction() is called.
  5. If exception occurrs, onException() is called.
Overrides:
handle in class org.webmacro.servlet.WMServlet
Returns:
template to be displayed
See Also:
TypeHandler

newSession

protected org.webmacro.Template newSession(org.webmacro.servlet.WebContext context)
Method called upon a new session. By default returns a template with new-session attribute set to "true".
Returns:
template to be displayed

onException

protected org.webmacro.Template onException(org.webmacro.servlet.WebContext context,
                                            java.lang.String form,
                                            java.lang.String action,
                                            ActionException e)
Method called if beforeInvoke(), action method or afterInvoke() throw an exception. Logs exception and calls error() by default.
Parameters:
context - context from handle() method
form - form that 'action' belongs to (null if not specified)
action - action which cannot be called due to the error (may be null if error occurrs while evaluating output variable and the action is not known)
e - exception which caused the error
Returns:
template to be displayed

onReturn

protected org.webmacro.Template onReturn(org.webmacro.servlet.WebContext context,
                                         java.lang.String form,
                                         java.lang.String action,
                                         java.lang.Object value)
                                  throws ActionException
Method called for unmatched values from <on-return> tags. Assumes value is a template or template name, by default.
Parameters:
context - context from handle() method
form - form that 'action' belongs to (null if not specified)
action - action which cannot be called due to the error
value - value returned by action method (null for void return type)
Returns:
template to be displayed
Throws:
ActionException - if no template of the name value cannot be found

start

public void start()
           throws javax.servlet.ServletException
Initialization of ActionServlet. Must be called as super.start(), if overriden.
Overrides:
start in class org.webmacro.servlet.WMServlet
Throws:
javax.servlet.ServletException - if startup fails

stop

protected void stop()
Called when the servlet is destroyed. Must be called as super.stop(), if overriden.
Overrides:
stop in class org.webmacro.servlet.WMServlet

unassignedAction

protected org.webmacro.Template unassignedAction(org.webmacro.servlet.WebContext context,
                                                 java.lang.String form,
                                                 java.lang.String action)
                                          throws ActionException
Method called if 'action' parameter is defined but not assigned to any method. Throws new ActionException by default.
Parameters:
context - context from handle() method
form - form that 'action' belongs to (null if not specified)
action - unassigned action name
Returns:
template to be displayed
Throws:
ActionException - on error of action method
